image.altText: Two ambulances travel on a road past a sign saying: Ashley Youth Detention Centre

items.synopsis: The union that represents workers at the Ashley Youth Detention Centre demands the government increase staffing levels at the facility, after a fire there resulted in a staff member being taken to hospital.

title.children: Union demands government to increase staff at youth detention centre, after second blaze within a month

image.altText: Pat Cummins speaks while standing arm in arm with Nathan Lyon and Alex Carey

items.synopsis: Australia falls just short of a first-innings lead, bowled out before lunch on day three for 386, still seven runs behind England. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Rain interrupts England's strong start to its second innings on day three

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: A shower has gone across the ground and the players are walking off. The coats are getting put on in the grandstand and the covers are being raced on.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Rain delay

children.content: A shower has gone across the ground and the players are walking off.
The coats are getting put on in the grandstand and the covers are being raced on.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Australia's skipper went for one more tonk and skied it miles in the air, with his opposite number, Ben Stokes, skulking in from the rope take the catch, ending Australia's innings. England's lead of seven runs isn't devastating or anything, but by losing 4-14 at the end of the innings Australia has left a potential 30- or 40-run lead on the table. How costly will that be? We won't know for a few days, but it feels like we're destined for a tight finish to this match.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Cummins goes and Australia finishes the first innings trailing England by just seven runs

children.content: Australia's skipper went for one more tonk and skied it miles in the air, with his opposite number, Ben Stokes, skulking in from the rope take the catch, ending Australia's innings.
England's lead of seven runs isn't devastating or anything, but by losing 4-14 at the end of the innings Australia has left a potential 30- or 40-run lead on the table.
How costly will that be? We won't know for a few days, but it feels like we're destined for a tight finish to this match.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: It seems like he got bored out as much as he was bowled out there. The tight umbrella field seemingly left him seemingly unsure what to do so he charged and missed a straight one from Robinson that cannoned into his off stump. A brilliant innings of 141 ends in disappointingly meek fashion.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: KHAWAJA IS BOWLED OUT OF NOWHERE!!

children.content: It seems like he got bored out as much as he was bowled out there.
The tight umbrella field seemingly left him seemingly unsure what to do so he charged and missed a straight one from Robinson that cannoned into his off stump.

props.alt: Australia batter Usman Khawaja swings his bat as his off stump is hit by a ball.

children.content: A brilliant innings of 141 ends in disappointingly meek fashion.

image.altText: Aerial shot of giant floating gas plant

items.synopsis: Off Australia's north coast, two of the world's energy titans are entwined in a fierce duel. How it came to pass is as much a story about corporate egos as it is flawed strategies.

title.children: Billions on the line as ego trumps 'logic' in race for Australian energy prize

image.altText: a map with a dot near a town called appin denoting where an earthquake struck

items.synopsis: The 3.1 magnitude tremor just north of Douglas Park strikes at 2.05pm on Sunday, at approximately 3 kilometres below the earth's crust.

title.children: Magnitude 3.1 earthquake strikes Appin region on the outskirts of Sydney's south-west

image.altText: An Indigenous woman cooks kangaroo tails on a campfire.

items.synopsis: In remote Australia, supply chains can stretch for thousands of kilometres, which means the cost of freighting fresh food is stretching budgets to breaking point.

title.children: Why a pumpkin costs $28, a 1.25L bottle of Coke is $7, and diesel is $3.37 a litre in this community

image.altText: Bridget McKenzie stands in a courtyard surrounded by journalists and microphones

items.synopsis: Coalition frontbencher Bridget McKenzie backs independent senator Lidia Thorpe's use of parliamentary privilege to detail allegations of sexual harassment at Parliament House.

title.children: Bridget McKenzie rebukes Barnaby Joyce, backs Lidia Thorpe for using Senate to raise allegations

image.altText: Queensland Police officers stand near vehicles at crime scene

items.synopsis: One man is dead and another is in custody after an alleged early morning assault at Noosa Heads on Queensland's Sunshine Coast.

title.children: Man dies after alleged assault while 'out for his morning walk' at Noosa Heads

image.altText: A close up of a woman's hand, holding a necklace made using eagle claws

items.synopsis: Each year more than a dozen endangered wedge-tailed eagles are killed in powerlines in Tasmania. An Aboriginal artist hopes her latest creations will raise awareness about the issue, and potentially help protect them from harm.

title.children: From powerline tragedy to cultural treasure: How art is being used to help endangered eagles

image.altText: A young man in a black face mask walks while surrounded by Indonesian police

items.synopsis: A 57-second video of a shocking assault kicked off a chain of events that ended the career of an Indonesian tax official and saw his 20-year-old son accused of beating a boy at the behest of his young girlfriend.

title.children: When a street fight video went viral, it took TikTok sleuths no time at all to find the rich kids allegedly involved

image.altText: Kathryn Harby-Williams

items.synopsis: Claims emerge that Netball Australia warned players they would not send a team to the World Cup unless they signed a new collective player agreement.

title.children: 'We won't send a team to the World Cup': Stunning claims emerge in netball's contract fiasco

image.altText: Boxer Tim Tszyu smiles at the camera, with fists clenched and a world title belt slun over his shoulder.

items.synopsis: Australian boxer Tim Tszyu knocks out Mexican Carlos Ocampo in the most impressive win of his career to retain the WBO super-welterweight world title.

title.children: 77 seconds of mayhem — Tim Tszyu finishes world interim title bout in half a round

image.altText: Edmund Burke

items.synopsis: A bequest of more than 1,900 books in 1851 by a former colonial secretary brought the world to Tasmania. Languages, revolutionary discoveries and "fake news" filled the library, some of which can still be found today.

title.children: 'Fake news' and 17th century texts: What books you could borrow in 1850s Tasmania

image.altText: Bouquets of flowers on the ground.

items.synopsis: Nine people remain in hospital one week after the shocking bus crash that killed 10 wedding guests, as the nation continues to come to terms with what happened.

title.children: Here's what we know so far, one week on from the deadly Hunter Valley bus crash

image.altText: A car on a race track with sparks flying underneath, with another vehicle behind with parachutes deployed

items.synopsis: Footage of the event shows the car hitting a barrier before continuing out of shot, narrowly missing a competitor's vehicle.

title.children: Driver in critical condition after car hits tyre barrier at Darwin drag race

image.altText: Car crashes into building at Healesville High School

items.synopsis: A man is airlifted to hospital with life-threatening injuries after his car crashed into a school at Healesville, north-east of Melbourne, leaving him in a critical condition.

title.children: Car ploughs into Victorian high school leaving driver with critical injuries

image.altText: Red and white tape blocks off the scene where a rust-coloured train derailed in outback scrub.

items.synopsis: More than a dozen iron ore train carts overturn, blocking a rail line, as a driverless train derails near Karratha overnight.

title.children: Investigation underway as driverless train operated by Rio Tinto derails in the Pilbara

image.altText: Two teenage boys in football gear carry a jersey onto the field

items.synopsis: Sporting fields around the Illawarra fell quiet on Saturday as tributes were paid to popular junior rugby league player Gervis Wililo who died after an e-bike accident.

title.children: 'Fly high young Gerv': Emotional tribute from sporting teammates for 13yo who died after e-bike crash

image.altText: Women wearing swimmers stand at the base of waterfall

items.synopsis: Is it secret women's business? No, it's women reaching out to make friends. When Tahlia Russell started a social media group for women in her region little did she know quite how popular it would become, with thousands joining within months.

title.children: Feeling disconnected, Tahlia created a social media group to make new friends — 5,000 women joined in six months

image.altText: A house sits in high flood waters.

items.synopsis: With demand for support exploding, the government has announced it will be expanding its multi-million-dollar scheme to help flood victims.

title.children: 'Protect home owners, taxpayers': Expansion of government scheme to offer additional support

image.altText: a close up of the microsoft logo, a window coloured red, green, blue, yellow

items.synopsis: After initially being reticent to confirm the attack, the company now says a group called Anonymous Sudan is behind the outage.

title.children: Microsoft says hacktivist group was behind Office outage this month

image.altText: Two men crouched over a coffin with a woman wrapped in a sheet inside.

items.synopsis: The family of the Ecuadorian 76-year-old continues to investigate why the woman was declared dead, before knocking on her coffin five hours into her wake.

title.children: Woman declared dead again … a week after knocking on her coffin at her own wake

image.altText: A Western Bulldogs AFL player grins at the crowd while sticking his tongue out and making a celebratory gesture after a goal.

items.synopsis: Cody Weightman's brilliance helps the Bulldogs overcome the Kangaroos at Docklands to take control of a top-eight spot — while Carlton upends the form book with a thumping win over the Suns.

title.children: Six of the best from Weightman as Bulldogs beat Kangaroos, after big win for Carlton

image.altText: A collage of three cricket players looking disappointed.

items.synopsis: The battle between Stuart Broad and David Warner has been a one-way street in the Ashes — but it's still not the worst "bunny" record in Test matches.

title.children: Broad has knocked over Warner again — but which batter has the worst bunny record in Test history?

image.altText: Max Vertsappen in his blue Red Bull F1 car, turning through a corner, ahead of Carlos Sainz in his red Ferrari.

items.synopsis: Red Bull is a perfect seven wins from seven races in 2023, with a commanding lead in the constructors' championship.

title.children: Everything you need to know about the Formula 1 Canadian Grand Prix

image.altText: Kylie Minogue sits on a red chair in a yard with dancers.

items.synopsis: Kylie Minogue's most dedicated fans have long been those in the queer community. Now, decades into her career, a new generation is discovering Australia's queen of pop on TikTok, and it couldn't have come at a better time.

title.children: Kylie Minogue has the song of the summer in America — and she threw out the old rulebook to get it there

image.altText: A white man with light brown hair stands outside and holds his cat and looks lovingly at it.

items.synopsis: Home was an affirming place when Kai and Noah came out. They want the same in Australian schools, but educators say more training is needed to learn how.

title.children: Kai wants other trans kids to feel safe and included at school

image.altText: Narelda Jacobs, wearing a denim jacket, poses for a photo holding her palm to the trunk of a paperbark tree

items.synopsis: With Australia's Voice referendum looming, I went back through the archives to learn more about the work my father did to bring us to this moment. But he was also ultra-conservative, and I didn't have to dig far to uncover his homophobia, writes Narelda Jacobs.

title.children: My dad fought for rights of First Nations people. But while researching his legacy, I uncovered hate in his teachings

image.altText: He stands in a dark blue shirt in front of a sign saying 'Cosmo' painted like the Aboriginal flag

items.synopsis: Sealing the 2,700-kilometre Outback Way could be good for remote artists. It could also bring more tourism, traffic, jobs and freight.

title.children: Sealing a road across inland Australia could forever change our most remote communities

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: Colombian military pose with children for a group found in jungle, with the childrens' faces blurred

items.synopsis: A spiritual tea made from rainforest plants is being credited with playing an important role in the search for four children lost in the Colombian Amazon jungle.

title.children: How rescuers used a hallucinogenic cocktail during the search for children lost in the Amazon

image.altText: Composite image of Lauren Jackson, basketball and marijuana plants

items.synopsis: Lauren Jackson was granted an exemption to take medicinal cannabis when she made a fairytale comeback to basketball. But its use — both within and outside sport — remains stigmatised while Australia's laws are difficult to understand and navigate.

title.children: More Australians are using medicinal cannabis than ever before. Is it effective for pain, and is it legal to take?

image.altText: A woman standing on the seaside with an ice-cream in her hand

items.synopsis: Unmarried women in China are banned from using assisted reproductive technologies, but these women are taking matters into their own hands.

title.children: 'Don't tell anyone about it, ever': Why unmarried Chinese women are freezing their eggs overseas

image.altText: a mother holds her baby son high in the air, they are both smiling and laughing

items.synopsis: Little Eli, now aged one, was born in Brisbane, half a world away from his parents' homeland of Ukraine. Mum Daryna is thankful her little boy has so far been shielded from the terror of war, but their family remains separated indefinitely.

title.children: Daryna fled Ukraine alone, pregnant and frightened. So far, her family has only had a few days together
